intro: Paramoltkia doerfleri, commonly known as the Doerfler's paramoltkia, is a rare and striking member of the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height. Its flowers, which appear in late spring, are typically yellow or orange and are clustered at the tips of the stems. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
